data.title: Write a Wiki Article on "Audio Handling" Documentation

milestone.title: Learning Curve
milestone.description: Improving the documentation of Duality and making it easier for new users to use and join the project.

data.body:
### Summary

Write a wiki article that deals with how to use the audio backend of Duality.

### Analysis

- Basics: Play sounds
- 3D sound effects
- adjust audio properties like panning, pitching, level (SoundInstance)
- tipps & tricks

data.title: Support Multiple SoundListeners at Once

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
### Summary

With the planned support for Camera-local viewports, split-screen setups would become easy to do - except for audio, which is constrained to only one listener. This should be addressed.

### Analysis

- The OpenAL backend as well as, potentially, other audio backends is limited to only a single listener.
- In order to make multiple listeners work, the Duality audio system could re-map all active audio sources to the single internal backend listener.
- A trivial implementation would assign all sources to the nearest / loudest listener and express them relative to it.
- Avoid hard changes in audio parameters when switching listeners. Fade from one to the next.
- Avoid extensive listener switches. Apply a threshold that needs to be crossed for a switch to occur.

data.title: Shape of Deactivated Rigidbody isn't visible in the RigidBody Editor

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
I'm not quite sure if this is a bug, so I will submit this issue anyway.

### The Problem

When you deactivate the rigidbody component of a gameobject and you want to draw some collision shapes, they aren't visible...

It makes sense, because the rigidbody is deactivated... so you shouldn't see any shapes, but you can still define shapes... got it? ðŸ˜€
 
![](http://i.imgur.com/tXrghzU.gif)

In this example, i defining shapes for the tree in the background. So just ignore the "house-gameobject" ðŸ˜‰ 

I think it would be nice if you could still see the shapes of the rigidbod in the rigidbody editor even if the rigidbody component is deactivated...

What do u think?

data.title: Create a Physics Sample Project

milestone.title: Learning Curve
milestone.description: Improving the documentation of Duality and making it easier for new users to use and join the project.

data.body:
### Summary

Create a new project that illustrates physics in Duality and that can serve as a starting point for new users on how to use both simple and complex parts of the system. As a side effect, it would also be a nice persistent testbed for development purposes.

### Analysis

- Structure the sample into multiple scenes, each with a distinct topic.
- The scenes should be grouped into "Basics" and "Advanced" folders.
- Things to cover:
  - Basic single-shape bodies
  - Multiple shapes per body
  - Joints
  - Raycasts
  - Sensor shapes
  - Restitution, Friction, Damping, Mass
  - Collision categories, groups
  - Applying force, impulse, velocity
- There should also be a basic click-and-drag tool throughout all scenes.

data.title: Allow Tile Variants in AutoTile Painting

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

Right now, AutoTiles will regularize all used tiles to one of the default tiles. Instead, when explicitly selecting a tile variant that matches the required corner connectivity, that one should be used in favor of the default one.

### Attachments

Tileset for testing:

![tileset](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14859411/21842761/75919fe2-d7e8-11e6-80c3-b0208c436434.png)

data.title: Improve Cloning Docs in Source Code

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

Improve documentation on public API surface of the cloning system, so it at least becomes clear what the different members of `ICloneExplicit`, `CloneSurrogate` etc. do and how they are used. Users should at least be enabled to provide their own surrogates and explicit cloning implementations where necessary.

### Analysis

- What's the difference between "handle" and "copy" methods in cloning?
- What happens behind the scenes?
- What needs to be handled by the user and what happens if it isn't done properly?
- This [blog entry](http://www.adamslair.net/blog/?p=1608) might help.

data.title: Cleanup Core API X / Y Usage

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
### Summary

There are some places in the Duality core API that use `X` / `Y` variants of a property to indicate `int` sizes and positions. Replace them with `Point2` accessors.

### Analysis

- Add the `Point2` accessors to v2.x and flag their `X` / `Y` counterparts as obsolete.
- Remove their `X` / `Y` counterparts in the `develop-3.0` branch.
- Be reasonable about it. Consider keeping the `X` / `Y` variant (and not obsoleting them) where it makes sense.

data.title: Cleanup Point2 and Vector2 Code Files (Tabs vs. Spaces)

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

For some reason, half of the indentation of `Point2.cs` and `Vector2.cs` is done with spaces, rather than tabs. Fix this.

data.title: Remove ByRef Vector2 Operator Alternatives

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
### Summary

The `Vector2` class has a lot of by-ref alternatives to common operators, like addition or subtraction. It is a questionable attempt at providing performance optimized code for near-trivial operations that clutter up the public API. Consider removing them.

### Analysis

- Flag them as `[Obsolete]` in v2.x.
- Remove them in the `develop-3.0` branch.
- Fix all `[Obsolete]` warnings in Duality.
- Fix all `[Obsolete]` warnings in FarseerDuality.

data.title: Introduce Arithmetic API to Point2

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

Conceptually, the `Point2` data structure is for storing `int`-based points in 2D space, as opposed to vector math. Still, it would be very useful to at least have basic add / subtract / multiply available for everyday tasks.

### Analysis

- Regular `Point2` operations to include:
  - -`Point2` --> `Point2`
  - `Point2` + `Point2` --> `Point2`
  - `Point2` - `Point2` --> `Point2`
  - `Point2` * `Point2` --> `Point2`
  - `Point2` * `int` --> `Point2`
  - `int` * `Point2` --> `Point2`
  - `Point2` / `Point2` --> `Point2`
  - `Point2` / `int` --> `Point2`
- Implicit cast to `Vector2` operations to include:
  - `Point2` * `float` --> `Vector2`
  - `float` * `Point2` --> `Vector2`
  - `Point2` / `float` --> `Vector2`

data.title: Introduce Serialization and Cloning Surrogates for HashSet<T>

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

There already are serialization and cloning surrogates for `Dictionary<T,U>`, but there is none for `HashSet<T>` yet. While serialization and cloning still work, they're rather inefficient on `HashSet<T>` because of examining its internal structure as opposed to just dealing with the collection items. Introducing optimized surrogates for `HashSet<T>` would greatly improve this.

### Analysis

- The surrogate for `Dictionary<T,U>` can likely serve as a basis for the new `HashSet<T>` surrogates, though they will be a little more reflection-dependent because of the lack of a non-generic `ISet` interface.
- Introducing a new surrogate _should_ be backwards compatible, but double-check this.

data.title: Uninitialized RigidBody When Created While in Sandbox Paused Mode

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

When starting the sandbox and pausing it, cloning or creating new RigidBodies will leave them uninitialized, so they won't participate in physical simulation.

### How to reproduce

- Set up a simple scene with a single RigidBody.
- Enter sandbox mode.
- Pause the sandbox.
- Clone the RigidBody.
- Resume the sandbox.

### Analysis

- The culprit is likely [this line](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/1a5137a65ca2fd0fc5905a37c7efa5fccde03dfc/Source/Core/Duality/Components/Physics/RigidBody.cs#L894) that will leave the RigidBody disabled while in the editor.
- Since RigidBody doesn't listen to execution context changes, a body that is created in a paused sandbox (editor mode) will remain disabled indefinitely.
- The easiest fix is probably adding an execution context check in `OnUpdate` that will enable the internal body when appropriate.

data.title: Develop 3.0
data.body:
### Pull Request Checklist

_This is a reminder on a few important traits of your Pull Request. **Do not add this to your description**._

- Have you read the [**wiki article** on contribution](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/wiki/How-to-Contribute)?
- Have you done your changes in a **PR-specific branch**? If not, create one and pull your changes into it before submitting. In case your PR gets rejected, your `master` branch won't be out of sync.
- Have you checked **spaces and tabs**? Use tabs for indentation and spaces for alignment.
- Does your **code style** match Duality code style?
- Have you **documented public API** you added or changed?
- Have you **tested thoroughly** forfunctionality, stability and usability?
- Do all of your changes and additions comply with the **comply with the [project license](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/master/LICENSE)**?

data.title: Unhandled Exception Attempting to Clone a Regex Instance

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

Something that popped up in the chat: Cloning / Serializing Regex instances isn't supported, but unfortunately it leads to verbose and hard to parse error messages due to an unhandled exception. See if this can be handled more gracefully.

### How to reproduce

- Use a Regex field in a custom Component and perform an operation that triggers a clone.
- Also check what happens on the serialization side.

### Attachments

- Screenshots with callstack and breaking case:

![unknown](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14859411/21581877/43f359a0-d043-11e6-824c-337ed781d4db.png)
![breaks](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14859411/21582059/100d9a04-d04a-11e6-87e4-8d2bb99772c7.png)

data.title: NativeWindow

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Allows to programmatically resize a resizeable window.
Although it looks a non-sense, I feel it's more counter-intuitive the fact that specifically setting a desired GfxHeight and Width in UserData gets ignored if the window is already resizeable by the user.

This normalizes the behavior of setting UserData and could be used, for example, to enforce a minimum/maximum window size, while leaving the user free to resize it between said limits.

*also, I think I didn't mess up the alignment this time* :)

data.title: Investigate Package Update Script Failing to Update Some Dependency Versions

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

In a recent package update script run, it failed to properly update a `AdamsLair.Duality.Editor` dependency in the `AdamsLair.Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps` nuspec, despite updating both. Investigate why this is the case and fix it, ideally before the next package release.

### How to reproduce

- What happened can be seen in [this commit](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/commit/85bce1561377b437f3fac5f95b69cf4181b23467).

### Workaround

- Check the package update script changes and manually fix potential errors, then amend the commit before merging.

data.title: Running Duality for the first time without internet access causes a crash.

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

A fresh Duality binary (no packages installed), when run without internet access, crashes with a `NullReferenceException` when the license agreement is accepted. The same result occurs when Duality is blocked in the firewall.

Bug reported by user **misthema** on Discord server.

### How to reproduce

- Turn off internet access, or block Duality in the firewall (this might be done by default on some systems?).
- Run a fresh Duality binary install (downloaded from http://dualitybin.adamslair.net).
- Accept license agreement.

### Possible solutions

- Some sort of handling for cases where internet access is unavailable.

### Attachments

- logfile_editor.txt:
```
[Edit] Msg: Updating Packages...
[Edit] ERR:   Failed to perform task: NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
              CallStack:
                 at Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageManager.GetDeepDependencyCount(IEnumerable`1 packages)
                 at Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageManager.OrderByDependencies(IList`1 packages)
                 at Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageManager.OrderByDependencies(IList`1 packages)
                 at Duality.Editor.Program.<FirstTimeSetup>d__1.MoveNext()
                 at Duality.Editor.Forms.ProcessingBigTaskDialog.WorkerThreadProc(Object args)
[Edit] ERR: An error occurred: FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'AdamsLair.WinForms, Version=1.0.16.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified.
            CallStack:
               at System.Windows.Forms.Control.MarshaledInvoke(Control caller, Delegate method, Object[] args, Boolean synchronous)
               at System.Windows.Forms.Control.Invoke(Delegate method, Object[] args)
               at Duality.Editor.Forms.SplashScreen.mainFormLoader_DoWork(Object sender, DoWorkEventArgs e)
               at System.ComponentModel.BackgroundWorker.OnDoWork(DoWorkEventArgs e)
               at System.ComponentModel.BackgroundWorker.WorkerThreadStart(Object argument)
```

data.title: Extend RequiredComponent to Support Interfaces / Abstract Classes

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

Right now, the `RequiredComponent` attribute only supports concrete classes, mainly since the editor will try to auto-instantiate component dependencies if they're not met yet. This should be extended to support interfaces and abstract classes, so requirements are not necessarily coupled directly to a specific component type.

### Analysis

- When requiring a non-concrete Component type, there should be a second parameter that specifies the default component type to instantiate in case of automatic dependency creation.
- Make sure that all auto-create code accounts for non-concrete component types.
- This issue might require breaking API changes. If that turns out to be true during investigation, move it to v3.0.

data.title: Remove UserData in Users Directory Support

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
### Summary

Remove support for storing user data in the machines user directory to keep a game 100% self-contained. This is already the default via `AppData.LocalUserData` being true. It's still possible to manually store things there via framework backend API, if someone is really determined to do that.

data.title: Remove Screen Resolution Change Support

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
### Summary

Changing screen resolution when running a game is a bad practice that should not be encouraged. Instead, games should adjust to fit the user-set resolution of the primary screen.

### Analysis

- Redefine `ScreenMode.Fullscreen` to have the same effect as `ScreenMode.Native`.
- Remove `ScreenMode.Native`.
- Remove API support to change the screen resolution.

data.title: Add DisplayDevice Logs to the OpenTK Backend

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

Log all available display devices and their current (not available) mode stats next to window stats when creating the native window. This could potentially help debug future VSync issues.

data.title: Improve Profiler Coverage and API With Regard to Spike Analysis

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

While the current profiler code does an overall decent job, the Min / Max stats are next to useless, because they are affected by loading / init states and never reset. There is also no "Other" profile counter that covers all frame times that are not included in rendering or updates. Both of this makes performance spike analysis unnecessarily hard.

### Analysis

- Introduce static profiler API to reset all min / max values.
- Introduce a hotkey to `ProfileRenderer` to invoke a min / max reset.
- Auto-invoke a min / max reset once at the beginning of the fifth game frame.
- Introduce a new "Other" profile counter that is set to the difference between the "Frame" counter and the sum of update and render.

data.title: Investigate Jittery VSync Rendering on Some Multi-Screen Setups

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

With VSync on, there appear to be irregular but persistent frame drops on some machines. Investigate the cause of this and fix or work around the issue.

### How to reproduce

- Open a Duality application with VSync and observe spikes in frame time in a ProfileRenderer.
- Alternatively, observe linear movement of an object, where frame drops show as a jittery / non-smooth motion. Sample project: [here](https://github.com/opentk/opentk/files/669266/VSyncTest.zip)
- Also, there is an OpenTK-only sample to reproduce this: [here](https://github.com/opentk/opentk/files/669568/JitterSample.zip)

### Workaround

- It seems that using the SDL2 backend of OpenTK fixes this (while introducing other window-related issues), so putting `SDL2.dll` next to the launcher application should get rid of jittering.

### Analysis

- There have been tests with OpenTK-only code that reproduced the issue, though generally somewhat less reliable than Duality samples. This may be due to different code paths being used / OpenGL coverage, but it leaves some uncertainty whether the cause for this is in OpenTK or Duality, or in neither of the two.
- When assuming the issue to be part of Duality, it would make sense to improve on Profiling to have better tools for investigation.
  - Reset min / max values of all profiles as a public API method.
  - Introduce a min / max reset hotkey to ProfileRenderer.
  - Introduce an "Unknown" profiler that is calculated by "Frame" profiler - sum of all other top-level profilers.
  - See if the "Unknown" profiler hints towards any spikes in frame time that were not yet investigated.
- This might be helpful: [Diagnose frame skips and stutter](http://make-aitee-work.blogspot.de/2014/02/diagnose-frame-skips-and-stutter-in.html)
- Other than that, continue investigating to which degree this is reproducable with OpenTK only and how SDL2 window management is different from OpenTK window management.

### Attachments

- Related [issue on OpenTK](https://github.com/opentk/opentk/issues/467)

data.title: Attempted To Create Prefab Without Checking Init Context, No Errors

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.title: Usage of multiple tilesets in a single tilemap

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
At the moment there is no way to assign multiple tilesets to a single tilemap. If you want to use e.g. two different tilesets, you have to create a new gameobject with a new TileMap- and TileMapRenderer-Component. Then you have to select the new added gameobject to paint the tiles of the other tileset.
In my opinion this isn't a really good workaround.

So there should be a way to add other tilesets to an list of tilesets in the tilemap.
The tile palette in the editor should recognize which tileset did you selected in the tilemap.

In [Tiled](http://www.mapeditor.org/) you can add multiple tileset to the current document and paint tiles in any tilemap layer.
TIled sets an unique id for each tile in every tileset.
The first tile in the first tileset has the id 1. The last tile e.g. 72.
In the second tileset the id of the first tile doesn't begin with 1, but rather with 73.
With this approach you can discern each tile.

What do u think?

data.title: Move Pixmap Atlas Generation From Pixmap to PixmapImporter

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
### Summary

With the new AssetManagement API and full support for import parameters and repeatable import operations, there might be no reason to keep atlas generation code inside the `Pixmap` class itself. Consider moving it to the `PixmapImporter` instead.

### Analysis

- Check what dependencies there are for animation-related Pixmap properties first, and whether they can be resolved otherwise. Keep it as-is, if not.

data.title: Create a Full Changelog for v3.0

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
### Summary

Create a full changelog for all the changes in v3.0, compared to v2.0.

data.title: MoveTo(Vector2) and MoveToAbs(Vector2) not changing Z coordinate

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body: As discussed on Discord, the `MoveTo(Vector2)` and `MoveToAbs(Vector2)` methods of `Transform` are slightly changed, not resetting the Z coordinate of the position by simply casting to `Vector3`. I did not find any similar methods or usages in the solution.
